original: Leijonhielm, Gerhard Augustsson, friherre, agronom, sekreterare, Nätt-rabyhamn, f. 29/8/82 i Nättraby, Blek. 1., av kapt., frih. August L. o. Hedvig Ehnemark. G. 21 m. Märta Lanner-stierna. Barn: Ingrid £. 22, Bengt 23, Christer 24, Carl Magnus 28. — Mog:-ex. i Karlskrona 01, agronomex. i Aln-arp 05. Inneh. skötseln av Sjuhalla egendom i Nättraby 08-29, deläg. i denna, sekr. i Blek. läns hush rsällsk. 17-47. Ordf. i Nättraby s :ns livs-medelsnd 17-18, led. av kommifullm. 19-29, kyrkoråd, skolråd, kyrkvärd, ordf. i kyrkofullm., skolstyr., Karlskronaortens jordbr :kassa. Blek. frukt-odlarförb., rev. i fam :bidragsnd, styr:-led. i Södra Sv:es fiskerifören. o. Lantmannaförb. i Karlshamn, led. av kyrkomötena 36, 38, 41 o. 46, landst:-omrrbefälh. Resor t. Danm. o. Tyskl. Skr.: Praktisk vägledn. i rotfruktsfrö-odling (08), Blek. läns hush:sällsk. 1914-39 (39), Jordbr. i Blek. (47). RNO, RVO, Hush rsällsk. stGM, LLA.
translated: Leijonhielm, Gerhard Augustsson, Baron, agronomist, secretary, Nättrabyhamn, b. 29/8/82 in Nättraby, Blekinge county, the eldest son of Captain, Baron August L. and Hedvig Ehnemark. Married on 21 to Märta Lannerstierna. Children: Ingrid, born in 1922, Bengt in 1923, Christer in 1924, and Carl Magnus in 1928. Passed the naval officer's examination in Karlskrona in 1901 and the agronomy examination in Alnarp in 1905. Managed the Sjuhalla estate in Nättraby from 1908 to 1929, part-owner of the estate. Secretary of the Blekinge County Agricultural Society from 1917 to 1947. Chairman of Nättraby's food supply committee from 1917 to 1918, commission delegate from 1919 to 1929, church council member, school council member, churchwarden, chairman of the church board, school board, Karlskrona region agricultural fund, Blekinge fruit growers association, member of the family allowance review board, and board member of the Southern Swedish Fishery Association and the Farmers' Association in Karlshamn. Participated in the church meetings in 1936, 1938, 1941, and 1946. Military district commander. Traveled to Denmark and Germany. Wrote: Practical guide for root vegetable seed cultivation (1908), Blekinge County Agricultural Society 1914-1939 (1939), Agriculture in Blekinge (1947). Received Royal Naval Order, Royal Swedish Order of Vasa, Swedish Agricultural Society's silver medal, and Rural Sciences Academy's honorary member.

education.description: Passed the naval officer's examination in Karlskrona
Passed the agronomy examination in Alnarp
